question_sentence: Which musician's 1988 hit shot to No. 1 in the iTunes charts after being performed at Sunday's Grammy Awards?
evidence: The four-time Grammy winner's song "Fast Car" topped the charts after she performed the hit as a duet with country singer Luke Combs at the ceremony in Los Angeles. Female artists dominated this year's awards, with Taylor Swift making history as the only artist ever to win the prize for album of the year four times.

question_sentence: How much will a 30-second ad during the Super Bowl cost advertisers?
evidence: The average cost of a 30-second ad spot at Sunday's Super Bowl, which was expected to attract more than 110 million viewers, marks a record high. The price has risen by 75% in the past 10 years and by more than 200% in 20 years.

question_sentence: The outgoing president of which African nation this week postponed the country's upcoming elections?
evidence: The previously stable West African democracy resident is teetering on the brink of crisis after President Macky Sall announced a unilateral decree, officially enacted on Monday, to postpone February elections until December. Amid allegations of corruption, critics claimed the move was an attempted coup, and riots broke out across the capital, Dakar.

question_sentence: A newly published study claims that which sport could be a form of child abuse?
evidence: The researchers, from the universities of Winchester, Nottingham Trent and Bournemouth, triggered controversy by arguing that the risk of major injury in the game goes against child abuse laws. The study found that "knocks to the head" can lead to dementia or Parkinson's, and that children who started playing younger were more likely to risk brain trauma, compared to those who took up the game at an older age.

question_sentence: What percentage of female civil servants in the UK's defence industry have experienced sexual harassment, according to a survey by the Prospect union?
evidence: More than 120 out of 200 female civil servants told Prospect that they had experienced sexual harassment at the Ministry of Defence or public sector defence agencies. About 100 private sector defence workers also responded to the trade union's survey, with just under half (47%) saying they had experienced sexual harassment.

question_sentence: Which streaming service signed a 10-year deal with the World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE)?
evidence: From January 2025, the streaming service will be the exclusive home of the WWE’s weekly live show "Raw". The 10-year rights contract is said to be worth at least $5 billion.

question_sentence: The hairdresser federation of which European country urged its members to charge men and women the same prices for haircuts?
evidence: Charles-Antoine Huybrechts, spokesperson for Febelhair (the Federation of Belgian Hairdressers), told VRT Radio 2 that "a distinction between prices for men and women should no longer persist in 2024", and is urging hairdressers to charge per minute instead. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A US appeals court has ruled that a $10bn lawsuit filed by which country against American gun manufacturers can go ahead?
evidence: The lawsuit claims that a "flood" of illegal guns across the border that is helping to arm drug kingpins is a result of "deliberate" business practices by the US gunmakers. A lower court dismissed the case in late 2022, prompting an appeal from the Mexican government. The gun industry's trade association has denied any wrongdoing.

question_sentence: Which English cathedral defended its decision to host a silent disco that is "categorically not a 'ravein the nave'"?
evidence: The Dean of Canterbury, the Very Reverend David Monteith,said the 1990s-themed silent discos would be "be appropriate to and respectful" of the cathedral. A petition to stop the discos, which has reached more than 1,700 signatures, said that the events would send the message that "entertainment deserves our attention more than God".

question_sentence: Latest data shows that cases of which sexually transmitted disease have hit a near 75-year high in the US?
evidence: Once almost completely eliminated in the US, syphilis cases have reached the highest level since the 1950s, after surging by more than 80% in five years, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Rates of the potentially deadly disease have also soared in England and in many other countries worldwide, with experts blaming a range of factors including increased drug useand a lack of sufficient medical care.

question_sentence: Which holiday is celebrated by millions of people this month?
evidence: Lunar New Year, which marks the first new moon of the lunar calendar, falls on February 10, kicking off the 15-day Spring Festival. According to the Chinese zodiac calendar, it is the Year of the Dragon. (Image credit: Costfoto/Sipa USA)

question_sentence: Which country is the top exporter of goods to the US?
evidence: Mexico is now the top exporter of goods into the US, according to new trade data released by the Commerce Department this week. Until this year, China held the top spot for the past two decades. (Image credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Britain’s King Charles III was diagnosed with cancer this week. Which member of the royal family will take on many of his public duties in his absence?
evidence: Prince William, Charles’ son and heir to the throne, is expected to take on many public duties as the 75-year-old British monarch seeks treatment. (Image credit: Chris Jackson/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which state saw hundreds of mudslides and floods this week?
evidence: A powerful storm system drenched parts of California, knocking out power as rivers of debris stretched across neighborhoods. (Image credit: Marcio Jose Sanchez/AP)

question_sentence: Which singer gave a rare performance at the Grammy Awards alongside country star Luke Combs?
evidence: Known for being notoriously private, Tracy Chapman performed her 1988 hit song “Fast Car” with country star Luke Combs. (Image credit: Mike Blake/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which company has been temporarily grounded from operating?
evidence: Virgin Galactic is grounded after a small part detached from a vehicle on its latest space tourism flight. The company is required to make “corrective actions” before it can return to flight. (Image credit: Nathan J Fish/Sun-News/USA Today Network/FILE)

question_sentence: Who won the Nevada Republican primary this week?
evidence: Around 63% of voters opted for “none of these candidates” on Nevada’s non-binding primary ballot. The GOP primary carried little weight because state Republicans awarded their delegates through party-run caucuses two days later, where former President Trump was on the ballot, but Nikki Haley was not. (Image credit: Ian Maule/Bloomberg/Getty Images)

question_sentence: What is the highest hurricane category on the Saffir-Simpson scale?
evidence: The scale goes up to Category 5, but scientists have renewed conversations about possibly adding a Category 6. (Image credit: NOAA/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which state will host the 2026 World Cup final?
evidence: MetLife Stadium in New Jersey will host the 2026 FIFA World Cup final, the global soccer governing body announced. (Image credit: Scott Boehm/AP)

question_sentence: Coca-Cola is making a new flavor permanent. What is it called?
evidence: Coca-Cola’s wacky offerings frequently come and go, but its latest Spiced flavor is the company’s first permanent addition in three years. (Image credit: The Coca-Cola Company)

question_sentence: What method did the suspect use to steal over $1,700 worth of fuel at a Delaware gas station near New Castle?
choices: He manipulated the gas pump with a device.
He siphoned fuel using a hose.
He bribed the gas station attendant.
He stole fuel from multiple gas stations simultaneously.

question_sentence: What historic dam is set to be removed on the Brandywine River in Wilmington?
What percentage of men report having no close friendships, according to the Survey Center for American Life?
What was the purpose of the 2024 Polar Bear Plunge at Rehoboth Beach?
choices: To break a world record in ocean swimming.
To raise money for Special Olympics Delaware.
To celebrate the arrival of winter.

question_sentence: What was the reason for the reward offered by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service regarding the shooting of a bald eagle near Clayton, Delaware?
choices: To promote awareness about bald eagles
To encourage birdwatching in the area
To gather information about the incident
To celebrate the recovery of the bald eagle population

question_sentence: What is the alternative funerary practice known as “natural organic reduction”?
During which period of Bob Marley’s life did he spend time living in Wilmington, Delaware?
choices: In the mid-1960s, off and on

question_sentence: What is the significance of Dennis William Michael Kirlin’s recent retirement in Wilmington?
choices: He was the last firefighter in Wilmington.
He was the first firefighter in Wilmington.
He retired after 100 years of service.
He is a family member of the Kirlin firefighting legacy.

question_sentence: What is the reason behind changing the date of Wilmington’s St. Patrick’s Day Parade this year?
choices: To align with Philadelphia’s parade date.
To avoid scheduling conflicts with other events.
To accommodate the availability of parade participants.

question_sentence: What was the reason behind a Delaware Wawa being stranded for four years?
